    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Aluum Enforcer</h1>The most common aluum is powered by the bound soul of a loyal city servant, but its creation is among the Pactmasters’ most guarded secrets. There are dozens of dormant aluums spread throughout Katapesh, and only someone wearing an aluum charm can activate and command one of these 14-foot-tall soldiers. The Pactmasters entrust few beyond the Zephyr Guard to carry these charms, and stealing such a charm is one of the most severe crimes in the city.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Construct</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=2">Arcana</a></u>, <u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=4">Crafting</a></u>)</b>: DC 29<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=476">Aluum Enforcer</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 10</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Aluum.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Aluum.png"></a><span alt="Uncommon Trait" class="traituncommon" title="Something of uncommon rarity requires special training or comes from a particular culture or part of the world. Some character choices give access to uncommon options, and the GM can choose to allow access for anyone. Less is known about uncommon creatures than common creatures. They typically can’t be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creature is increased by 2."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=159">Uncommon</a></span><span alt="Neutral" class="traitalignment" title="Neutral">N</span><span alt="Large" class="traitsize" title="Large">Large</span><span alt="Construct Trait" class="trait" title="A construct is an artificial creature empowered by a force other than necromancy. Constructs are often mindless; they are immune to disease, the paralyzed condition, and poison; and they may have Hardness based on the materials used to construct their bodies. Constructs are not living creatures, nor are they undead. When reduced to 0 Hit Points, a construct creature is destroyed."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=35">Construct</a></span><span alt="Mindless Trait" class="trait" title="A mindless creature has either programmed or rudimentary mental attributes. Most, if not all, of their mental ability modifiers are –5. They are immune to all mental effects."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=108">Mindless</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq02065" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 82</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +17; darkvision<br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3"><u>Athletics</a></u> +23<br /><b>Str</b> +7, <b>Dex</b> +2, <b>Con</b> +5, <b>Int</b> -5, <b>Wis</b> +1, <b>Cha</b> -5<hr /><b>AC</b> 30, <b>Fort</b> +21, <b>Ref</b> +18, <b>Will</b> +15<br /><b>HP</b> 145; <b>Immunities</b> bleed, disease, death effects, doomed, drained, fatigued, magic (see below), mental, nonlethal attacks, paralyzed, poison, sickened, unconscious; <b>Resistances</b> 10 physical (except adamantine)<br /><b>Attack of Opportunity</b><img class="actiondark" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction_I.png"><hr /><b>Speed</b> 25 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> fist +23 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 2d10+13 bludgeoning plus paralyzing force</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Aluum Antimagic</b> Aluum enforcers are immune to spells and magical abilities, with two exceptions. A <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=118">negative</a> spell or magical ability grants an aluum enforcer the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=32">quickened</a> condition until the end of its next turn instead of its normal effects. A <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=128">positive</a> spell or ability makes an aluum enforcer <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=35">slowed 1</a> until the end of its next turn instead of its normal effects.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Paralyzing Force</b> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=11"><u>arcane</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=93"><u>incapacitation</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=117"><u>necromancy</a></u>) A creature damaged by the aluum enforcer’s fist Strike must succeed at a DC 27 Fortitude save or become <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=28">paralyzed</a> for 1 round. On a critical failure, the creature is paralyzed for 1d4 minutes and falls <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=31">prone</a>.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Soul Shriek</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=11"><u>arcane</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=16"><u>auditory</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=65"><u>evocation</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=106"><u>mental</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=147"><u>sonic</a></u>) The aluum enforcer emits a keening wail in a 15-foot cone that deals 9d6 sonic damage (DC 27 basic Fortitude save). A creature that fails its save is <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=36">stunned 1</a>, or stunned 3 on a critical failure. The aluum can’t use Soul Shriek again for 1d4 rounds.</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=113">Aluum</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=476">Aluum Enforcer</a></td><td>10</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=477">Spiritbound Aluum</a></td><td>16</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=113">Aluum</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq02065" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 82</i></a><br />Aluums are powerful metal and stone constructs originally created by the Pactmasters to maintain order in Katapesh. The construction of each aluum includes the creation of an <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Equipment.aspx?ID=560"><i>aluum charm</i></a>, a brass pendant set with a blue crystal designed to control that particular construct. The charm constructed at the same time as an aluum is called its linked charm.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Loyal City Servants</h3>Retired Zephyr Guards are the most common soul donors bound within an aluum’s crystalline focus, typically agreeing to it early in their career in exchange for a higher salary.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Rogue Aluums</h3>Although members of the Zephyr Guard stop at nothing to detain and destroy rogue aluums, several such renegade spiritbound aluums remain at large.<br /><br /> <b>Daemon of Dogtown</b>: Following the Silk Riots of 4303 AR, the Pactmasters dispatched this aluum to eliminate straggling instigators. It succeeded, but not before gaining sentience and enacting a 3-day string of murders. Although officials claim it was destroyed, the so-called Daemon of Dogtown’s body was never actually recovered, leading to rumors that it still haunts the outskirts of Katapesh.<br /><br /> <b>Queen Halkuar</b>: Assigned to protect a gnoll emissary from the Spotted Hide pack, this aluum failed to protect its charge from assassins. Instinctively, it bound the gnoll’s soul, assumed the fabricated persona of “Queen Halkuar,” and fled into the hinterlands. The queen is said to still wander the wastes in search of additional “packmates.”</span>

                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
</body>
</html>
